description: From the French tenable, from tenir (“to hold”); compare tenible.

adjectives.description: tenable (comparative more tenable, superlative most tenable)

entries.meaning: (of a theory, argument, etc.) capable of being maintained or justified; well-founded
examples: Back in the 1800s, many did not consider Darwin's theory of evolution to be tenable at all.

entries.meaning: (military) Capable of being defended against assault or attack; defensible
Fit for habitation, similar, or related use.
